node.title: Review of ballistics evidence ordered 25 years after Jeffery Brooks was shot dead
node.description: NSW Police will review ballistics evidence more than 25 years after the 24-year-old was shot dead on a farm south of Brisbane, as an inquest investigates who pulled the trigger.
node.content:
["Interstate police will undertake an independent ballistics review of the case of Jeffrey Brooks, more than 25 years after his mysterious\u00a0death on a farm south of Brisbane.", "A pre-inquest hearing held in the Queensland Coroners Court at Southport today also heard one of the lead detectives in the original investigation into Mr Brooks death \u2014 now Assistant Commissioner Mike Condon \u2014 would be called to give evidence in the inquiry, which will be held next year.", "Mr Brooks, 24, died after being shot in the chest by a 12-gauge single-barrel shotgun at a Beenleigh crayfish farm in March 1996.", "Police initially said the man from Lismore, NSW, had shot himself by accident while reaching for the shotgun.", "In 1998\u00a0a Queensland coroner handed down an open finding around the circumstances of Mr Brooks' death, meaning suspicious circumstances could not be ruled out.", "Mr Brooks' family have always believed another person killed their son.", "In recent years, former Queensland Attorney-General Yvette D'Ath announced a new inquiry into Mr Brooks death, following appeals and new evidence provided by the man's family.", "During the pre-inquest hearing on Thursday, counsel assisting the coroner Alana Martens said NSW police would undertake an independent review of the ballistics evidence, which is expected to be complete in two months.", "", "
Wendy and Lawrie Brooks told\u00a0media outside court they \"want justice for our son.\"(ABC Gold Coast: Alexandria Utting)
", "The inquiry heard a number of media organisations had also undertaken independent investigations of the case and this evidence had been provided to Coroner Jane Bentley and soon would be with all parties.", "Former farm manager Hans Geiger, who appeared in court today via phone, will also be called to give evidence in the inquest next February.", "When asked if he wished to be formally listed as a party to the inquiry, he today told the court\u00a0\"I don't see any need for be to (be a witness) as I wasn't on the farm at this time.\"", "Ms Bentley told Mr Geiger he would be called to give evidence regardless and should seek legal advice as to whether he wished to be listed as a party.", "Outside court\u00a0Mr Brooks parents Wendy and Lawrie Brooks said they were \"glad the ball has started rolling.\"", "She\u00a0said while it would be tough to relive the memories, the \"truth would come out.\"", "The inquest is set down from February 22\u00a0next year."]
